channel.title: Personal on Yet another
channel.description: Recent content in Personal on Yet another

item.title: smalltalk
item.description:
I’ve always been an expert in forgetting faces. Or names. Lately they have been getting worse. Was it always like this?

At first, they were unnoticeable things. Inconspicious things that is not even worthy to be remembered. It is normal to forget names and faces and places and things.

I would also like to mention that my eyesight has been getting worse lately. I’m 24 with astigmatism and over 150⁄150+ vision.

As an armchair optometrist/psychologist, I have a theory (hunch? assertion? guess?) that memory is linked to blurred vision. Once the sight has dulled, the ability to retain details in memory will dull too. It makes sense that with clear vision, a person has a lot more detail to work with when remembering things. A quick Google search does not show any studies related to this. Should I ask a psychologist? Or maybe AskScience, maybe later.

And right, it is Christmas in our side of the world. Merry christmas everyone :)

item.title: about
item.description:
I am Nathaniel M. Capule, a graduate of BS Computer Science in UP Los Baños. Welcome to my site ;)

    • UP Los Baños - BS Computer Sciece (2007-2012)
  5. Graduate
    • UP Diliman - MS Computer Science (2015-present)
Work experience

    • Android, iOS, Java, Objective C
  2. Indra Philippines - Junior Consultant (2012-2013)
    • Java, Oracle SQL, Powerbuilder
  3. Samsung R&D Philippines - Engineer (2013-2015)
    • Android, iOS, Java, Objective C, C++, C, Python, HTML/CSS/Javascript, UNIX tools, Git, JIRA, Jenkins
  4. Concentrix (2015-present)
    • Python, Java, HTML/CSS/Javascript, GAE, UNIX tools, Git
